emuInput.TitMainTitle: Catholic War Veterans Lloyd Davis, Florence Robinson, Commander Peter Hopkins, Louise L. Vogelsang, and Frank V. Middleton gathered during 24th annual CWV convention at Penn - Sheraton Hotel
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 22, 1959, pg. A2, reads: "Catholic War Vets - Shown with outgoing National Commander Peter Hopkins of the Catholic War Veterans, center, are, left to right: Lloyd Davis, chairman of the 1960 convention, to be held in August in Chicago; Mrs. Florence Robinson, distinguished social worker and CWV Ladies Auxiliary trustee for the Department of Illinois; Mrs. Louise L. Vogelsang, perhaps the only Negro woman in the United States to head a state department of a veteran's organization, because she is president of the New York Department of 70 posts, extending from Long Island to the American side of Niagara Falls, and Frank V. Middleton of Chicago, historian of the Department of Illinois, CWV. - Harris Photo."
